Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of Prophylactic Fibrinogen Administration in Paediatric Scoliosis Surgery

Trial_Design.evidence: This two-arm, single-centre, randomised, double-blind trial

Participants.evidence: Thirty-two children undergoing elective scoliosis surgery were randomised

Intervention.evidence: randomised 1:1 to receive either standard blood and coagulation management or a single prophylactic dose of fibrinogen concentrate

Objective.evidence: This study assesses the safety and feasibility of prophylactic fibrinogen administration in paediatric scoliosis surgery.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was safety, assessed by adverse events (AEs) and serious adverse events (SAEs) during the hospital stay.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was computer-generated with allocation concealment via a web-based system.

Blinding.evidence: Blinding included patients, clinicians, and outcome assessors.

Number_Randomised.evidence: Between June 2022 and June 2023, 32 participants were randomised, with 16 in each group.

Number_Analysed.evidence: All were analysed using an intention-to-treat approach.

Result_Outcome.evidence: Blood loss did not significantly differ between the fibrinogen (1021.88 mL, SD 473.63) and standard (859.38 mL, SD 713.03) groups (p=0.1677).

Harms.evidence: In the fibrinogen group, 101 AEs across 19 types were observed, while the standard group had 95 AEs across 21 types (p>0.9999).
